asypad.shapes

Class Utility

  • java.lang.Object
    • asypad.shapes.Utility

  • public class Utility
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility that contains useful functions.
    Author:
    Raymond Feng, Anthony Wang

        m1 - slope of first equation
        b1 - y-intercept of first equation
        m2 - slope of second equation
        b2 - y-intercept of second equation
        Returns:
        x-value that satisfies both equation

      • intersectX

        public static double intersectX(Line l1,
                                Line l2)
        The x-value of the point that lies on both lines. If the intersection point does not lie in between the endpoints returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
        Parameters:
        l1 - first line
        l2 - second line
        Returns:
        x-coordinate of intersection point

      • intersectY

        public static double intersectY(Line l1,
                                Line l2)
        The y-value of the point that lies on both lines. If the intersection point does not lie in between the endpoints returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
        Parameters:
        l1 - first line
        l2 - second line
        Returns:
        y-coordinate of intersection point

      • intersectX

        public static double intersectX(Line l,
                                Circle c,
                                boolean identifier)
        Calculates an intersection point between the line and the circle. If there is more than one intersection point, identifier = true means to return the x-coordinate of the intersection that is closer to the start of the line. If such an intersection point is non-existent returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINTY.
        Parameters:
        l - line
        c - circle
        identifier - distinguishes between the possibly 2 different intersection points
        Returns:
        x-coordinate of the appropriate intersection

      • intersectY

        public static double intersectY(Line l,
                                Circle c,
                                boolean identifier)
        Calculates an intersection point between the line and the circle. If there is more than one intersection point, identifier = true means to return the y-coordinate of the intersection that is closer to the start of the line. If such an intersection point is non-existent returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINTY.
        Parameters:
        l - line
        c - circle
        identifier - distinguishes between the possibly 2 different intersection points
        Returns:
        y-coordinate of the appropriate intersection

      • intersectX

        public static double intersectX(Circle c1,
                                Circle c2,
                                boolean identifier)
        Calculates an intersection point between the two circles. If there is more than one intersection point, identifier = true means to return the x-coordinate of the intersection that is more counterclockwise wrt the first circle. If such an intersection point is non-existent returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINTY.
        Parameters:
        c1 - circle 1
        c2 - circle 2
        identifier - distinguishes between the possibly 2 different intersection points
        Returns:
        x-coordinate of the appropriate intersection

      • intersectY

        public static double intersectY(Circle c1,
                                Circle c2,
                                boolean identifier)
        Calculates an intersection point between the two circles. If there is more than one intersection point, identifier = true means to return the y-coordinate of the intersection that is more counterclockwise wrt the first circle. If such an intersection point is non-existent returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINTY.
        Parameters:
        c1 - circle 1
        c2 - circle 2
        identifier - distinguishes between the possibly 2 different intersection points
        Returns:
        y-coordinate of the appropriate intersection

      • distToL

        public static double distToL(double lx1,
                             double ly1,
                             double lx2,
                             double ly2,
                             double x1,
                             double y1)
        Calculates distance from a point (x1, y1) to the line containing (lx1, ly1) and (lx2, ly2).
        Parameters:
        lx1 - x-coordinate of first point on line
        ly1 - y-coordinate of first point on line
        lx2 - x-coordinate of second point on line
        ly2 - y-coordinate of second point on line
        x1 - x-coordinate of point
        y1 - y-coordinate of point
        Returns:
        distance from (x1, y1) to the line containing (lx1, ly1) and (lx2, ly2)

      • angleBisectorX

        public static double angleBisectorX(Point p1,
                                    Point p2,
                                    Point p3)
        Calculates the x-coordinate of the point that lies on the angle bisector of angle p1p2p3, and is 1 unit away from p2.
        Parameters:
        p1 - first point
        p2 - second point (vertex of angle)
        p3 - third point
        Returns:
        x-coordinate of point on angle bisector, 1 unit away from p2.

      • angleBisectorY

        public static double angleBisectorY(Point p1,
                                    Point p2,
                                    Point p3)
        Calculates the y-coordinate of the point that lies on the angle bisector of angle p1p2p3, and is 1 unit away from p2.
        Parameters:
        p1 - first point
        p2 - second point (vertex of angle)
        p3 - third point
        Returns:
        y-coordinate of point on angle bisector, 1 unit away from p2.

      • tangentX

        public static double tangentX(double x,
                              double y,
                              Circle c,
                              boolean identifier)
        Finds the x-coordinate of the point such that the line formed by the point and the given point is tangent to the circle. identifier is used to find which point (true = point more counterclockwise wrt the first circle). If it is on the circle, finds the point 1 unit away and in the positive x direction from the given point. If it is inside the circle, returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate
        y - y-coordinate
        c - circle
        identifier - distinguishes between the possibly 2 different points
        Returns:
        x coordinate of the point described above

      • tangentY

        public static double tangentY(double x,
                              double y,
                              Circle c,
                              boolean identifier)
        Finds the y-coordinate of the point such that the line formed by the point and the given point is tangent to the circle. identifier is used to find which point (true = point more counterclockwise wrt the first circle). If it is on the circle, finds the point 1 unit away and in the positive y direction from the given point. If it is a vertical line, returns 1 unit down. If it is inside the circle, returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate
        y - y-coordinate
        c - circle
        identifier - distinguishes between the possibly 2 different points
        Returns:
        x coordinate of the point described above

      • tangentCircleX

        public static double tangentCircleX(Circle c1,
                                    Circle c2,
                                    Point p,
                                    boolean identifier)
        Finds the x-coordinate of the center of the circle tangent to the two given non-intersecting circles going through the given point. identifier = true means it is internally tangent to one of the circles and externally tangent to another. If such a circle doesn't exist, returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY
        Parameters:
        c1 - first circle
        c2 - second circle
        p - point
        identifier - distinguishes between the possibly 2 different circles
        Returns:
        x-coordinate of the described circle.

      • tangentCircleY

        public static double tangentCircleY(Circle c1,
                                    Circle c2,
                                    Point p,
                                    boolean identifier)
        Finds the y-coordinate of the center of the circle tangent to the two given non-intersecting circles going through the given point. identifier = true means it is internally tangent to one of the circles and externally tangent to another. If such a circle doesn't exist, returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY
        Parameters:
        c1 - first circle
        c2 - second circle
        p - point
        identifier - distinguishes between the possibly 2 different circles
        Returns:
        y-coordinate of the described circle.

      • distToShape

        public static double distToShape(double x,
                                 double y,
                                 Shape s)
        Finds distance from (x, y) to shape s.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate
        y - y-coordinate
        s - target shape
        Returns:
        distance from (x y) to s

      • signumstar

        public static double signumstar(double d)
        This is the equivalent of the sgn* function. Returns -1 if d < 0, 1 otherwise. (In particular, signumstar(0)=1)
        Parameters:
        d - double to take sgn* of
        Returns:
        sgn*(d)

      • equal

        public static boolean equal(double d1,
                            double d2)
        Whether the two doubles are equal (since rounding errors exist)
        Parameters:
        d1 - first double
        d2 - second double
        Returns:
        whether |d1-d2| < 0.0001 = epsilon

        public static java.lang.String hex(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Hexes a Color into string format.
        Parameters:
        color - the Color to be hexed
        Returns:
        String rgb representation of the Color.
